extends java.lang.Object
    The class contains a set of methods required for the lab to work properly

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static Players[] addPlayer​(Players[] players, Players aPlayer)
      The addPlayer method makes a new array of the old size plus one
      Next it copies the players from the old array to the new array
      Next it adds the new player in last index of the new array
      static Players createPlayer​(java.util.Scanner kb)
      The createPlayer method prompts the user to enter information to create a new player Entering the information is done by the private method readString.
      static Players[] fillArray​(java.util.Scanner fin, int total)
      The fillArray method first creates an array of players, and then fills each index of the player array with a new player object.
      static int menu​(java.util.Scanner kb)
      The menu method offers the user a choice from:
      1) Print the players to the screen
      2) Print the players to a file
      3) Sort the players based on natural order
      4) Sort the players based on total order
      5) Add a new player to the players
      6) Search the players for a player
      7) Quit
      static void printPlayers​(Players[] myPlayers, java.io.PrintStream out)
      The printplayers calls the toString method of players and prints each player out followed by a CR
      static java.lang.String readOutputFilename​(java.util.Scanner kb)
      The readOutputFilename calls the readString to read a output filename
      private static java.lang.String readString​(java.lang.String type, java.util.Scanner kb)
      The readString reads a string from the keyboard and ensures the string is not null or empty

      • fillArray

        public static Players[] fillArray​(java.util.Scanner fin,
                                  int total)
                           throws java.text.ParseException
        The fillArray method first creates an array of players, and then fills each index of the player array with a new player object.
        Parameters:
        fin - Representing the Scanner object to the file
        total - Representing the total number of elements to be contained in the array
        Returns:
        Player [] Representing array filled with Player objects
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if fin is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if total is < 1
        java.text.ParseException

      • menu

        public static int menu​(java.util.Scanner kb)
        The menu method offers the user a choice from:
        1) Print the players to the screen
        2) Print the players to a file
        3) Sort the players based on natural order
        4) Sort the players based on total order
        5) Add a new player to the players
        6) Search the players for a player
        7) Quit
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        Returns:
        int Representing the menu choice which is ensured by you to be between 1 and 7 inclusive
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null

      • printPlayers

        public static void printPlayers​(Players[] myPlayers,
                                java.io.PrintStream out)
        The printplayers calls the toString method of players and prints each player out followed by a CR
        Parameters:
        myPlayers - Representing the array of players
        out - Representing the PrintStream object to the screen or the file
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if array is null or the length is < 1
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if output stream is null

        public static java.lang.String readOutputFilename​(java.util.Scanner kb)
        The readOutputFilename calls the readString to read a output filename
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        Returns:
        String Representing the output filename
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null

      • addPlayer

        public static Players[] addPlayer​(Players[] players,
                                  Players aPlayer)
        The addPlayer method makes a new array of the old size plus one
        Next it copies the players from the old array to the new array
        Next it adds the new player in last index of the new array
        Parameters:
        players - Representing the old array to be copied
        aPlayer - Representing the player to add to the array
        Returns:
        Players [] Representing the new array with the old players copied over and the new player in the last index of the new array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if array is null or length < 1
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if aPlayer is null

      • createPlayer

        public static Players createPlayer​(java.util.Scanner kb)
                            throws java.text.ParseException
        The createPlayer method prompts the user to enter information to create a new player Entering the information is done by the private method readString.
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        Returns:
        Players Representing a new player object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null
        java.text.ParseException - if the date cannot be parsed correctly

      • readString

        private static java.lang.String readString​(java.lang.String type,
                                           java.util.Scanner kb)
        The readString reads a string from the keyboard and ensures the string is not null or empty
        Parameters:
        type - Representing a String for the prompt on what to enter
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        Returns:
        String Representing the appropriate String
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null
